column4: i hate to sound like an idiot, its obvious how new i am, how do i install something like a game
how do i install an rpm?

you don't use rpms. ubuntu uses debs and they are installed through synaptic or apt-get (or aptitude). synaptic is a nice graphical installer. it's easy to use and there are thousands of choices of packages. you won't be dissapointed.
tar.gz is just a compressed file like a zip
if you don't see the programs i mentioned you need to add the universe source
ubuntu has over 16,000 packages if you enable all components
99% of software is in ubuntu and most likely everything you'll want or need
you hit apply and then installed it
just add a menu entry with smeg or a desktop icon
unfortunately gnome 2.10 has no menu editor. breezy will have gnome's menu editor AND smeg
